intro: Ferulago oxyptera, commonly known as the Narrow-leafed Ferulago, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, aromatic leaves and small white or greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in Mediterranean climates. Its fruit is a dry schizocarp, splitting into two one-seeded parts when mature, a common feature in the Apiaceae family.
